physical.translation[0].definitions[0].d: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions
physical.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She was in constant physical pain.
the physical and emotional needs of young adults
Don’t be put off by his physical appearance.
He was obsessed with physical fitness.
physical.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a physical relationship involves sex rather than just friendship
physical.translation[0].definitions[1].e: My attraction to him was totally physical.
Their physical relationship had never been very good.
physical.translation[0].definitions[2].d: someone who is physical likes touching people a lot
physical.translation[0].definitions[3].d: involving touching someone in a rough or violent way
physical.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Football can be a very physical game.
I was a bit worried that the argument might become physical.
physical.translation[0].definitions[4].d: relating to real objects that you can touch, see, or feel
physical.translation[0].definitions[4].e: They were kept in appalling physical conditions.
physical.translation[0].definitions[5].d: relating to or following natural laws
physical.translation[0].definitions[5].e: a physical explanation for this phenomenon
physical.translation[0].definitions[6].d: a physical science is an area of scientific study that is related to physics
physical.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: We all know about the health benefits of physical activity.
There shall be no intentional physical contact between teams.
He had suffered physical abuse at the hands of his parents.
She bravely endured great physical pain.
The murder could have been committed only by a man of enormous physical strength.
You need to work on your physical fitness.
From birth he has suffered from severe physical disabilities.
Most babies are born without physical defects.
physical.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a thorough examination of someone’s body by a doctor, in order to discover whether they are healthy or have any illnesses or medical problems
physical.translation[2].definitions[0].e: the physical counting of goods in stock
physical.translation[2].definitions[1].d: related to assets that can be seen and touched, such as machines and buildings
physical.translation[2].definitions[1].e: They had a physical plant valued at $3,455,050 and cash reserves of $729,886.
physical.translation[2].definitions[2].d: involving shares, bonds etc where there are CERTIFICATEs (=documents showing ownership), rather than shares etc where ownership is recorded on a computer
physical.translation[2].definitions[2].e: It’s hard to imagine that many investors would prefer having physical certificates when a computer entry seems at least as reliable.
physical.translation[2].definitions[3].d: involving COMMODITIES (=oil, metals, farm products etc) for actual or immediate delivery, rather than FUTURES (=contracts for delivery at a later date)
physical.translation[2].definitions[3].e: Traders of agricultural futures contracts usually don’t take physical delivery of the underlying commodity.
